definition: to blow/to play a wind instrument/to blast/to puff/to boast/to brag/to end in failure/to fall through

sentences.english: As such this contribution is rather a blatant example of ego-tripping and questionable self-promotion on the part of the author.
sentences.chinese: 所以，這看起來更像是作者的自吹自擂和自我宣傳。

sentences.english: Here you have every right, and perhaps an obligation, to toot your own horn and be a bit egotistical.
sentences.chinese: 這個問題上，你有權利或者是義務來自吹自擂。

sentences.english: His letter is just a self-serving and self promotion.
sentences.chinese: 他寫的這信不過是自吹自擂來提高自己的聲望。

sentences.english: His bragging is just a front for his insincerity.
sentences.chinese: 她的自吹自擂不過是不真誠的幌子。

sentences.english: I get fed uo with anyone who brags all the time.
sentences.chinese: 我討厭總是自吹自擂的人。

sentences.english: And you're right, the Americans should not be boastful in this regard.
sentences.chinese: 你說得對，美國不該在這方面自吹自擂。

sentences.english: Behavior characteristic is self- dramatizing , mincing.
sentences.chinese: 行爲特點是自吹自擂，裝腔作勢。

sentences.english: Dont believe all he says — hes a bit of a boaster.
sentences.chinese: 別全信他說的，他有點自吹自擂。

sentences.english: We must never brag and boast .
She has been on an ego trip since she sang on television.
sentences.chinese: 她上電視臺唱過歌之後就一直自吹自擂。

sentences.english: Because of his bragging—and his great skill—Gen lands in the King's prison, shackled to the wall of his cell.
sentences.chinese: 鄭因爲他的高超技術和自吹自擂而鋃鐺入獄。

sentences.english: Beetle stretched his wings and flew away boastfully.
sentences.chinese: 甲蟲伸伸翅膀，自吹自擂的飛走了。

sentences.english: He's fathered at least four children with mistresses, and he boasts about it.
sentences.chinese: 他與情婦至少已有四個孩子，對此他還自吹自擂。

sentences.english: There was no bombast or conceit in his speech.
sentences.chinese: 他的演講並沒有誇大其詞和自吹自擂。

sentences.english: He is a very modest man who never blows his owm trumpet.
sentences.chinese: 他爲人非常謙遜從不自吹自擂。

sentences.english: Don’t brag, make sure they are relevant to the conversation.

definition: to speak without thinking (idiom)/to blurt sth out
to talk big/to shoot off one's mouth/to chat (dialect)
to show off/to make a display of
to angle for fame (idiom)/to fish for compliments
